distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat JBoss Core Services.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat JBoss Core Services is a set of supplementary software for Red Hat JBoss middleware products. This software, such as Apache HTTP Server, is common to multiple JBoss middleware products and packaged under Red Hat JBoss Core Services, to allow for faster distribution of updates and for a more consistent update experience.

This release of Red Hat JBoss Core Services Apache HTTP Server 2.4.51 serves as a replacement for Red Hat JBoss Core Services Apache HTTP Server 2.4.37 Service Pack 10, and includes bug fixes and enhancements, which are documented in the Release Notes linked to in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* httpd: Request splitting via HTTP/2 method injection and mod_proxy (CVE-2021-33193)

* httpd: mod_proxy_uwsgi: out-of-bounds read via a crafted request uri-path (CVE-2021-36160)

* httpd: Out-of-bounds write in ap_escape_quotes() via malicious input (CVE-2021-39275)

* httpd: NULL pointer dereference via crafted request during HTTP/2 request processing (CVE-2021-41524)

* httpd: possible NULL dereference or SSRF in forward proxy configurations (CVE-2021-44224)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A NULL pointer dereference was found in Apache httpd mod_h2. The highest threat from this flaw is to system integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2021-33193 httpd: Request splitting via HTTP/2 method injection and mod_proxy
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Applications using the APR libraries, such as httpd, must be restarted for this update to take effect. After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.
This flaw can be mitigated by disabling HTTP/2. More information available at: https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_http2.html

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-33193 httpd: Request splitting via HTTP/2 method injection and mod_proxy

notes.text: An out-of-bounds read in mod_proxy_uwsgi of httpd allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to crash the service through a crafted request. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2021-36160 httpd: mod_proxy_uwsgi: out-of-bounds read via a crafted request uri-path
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Applications using the APR libraries, such as httpd, must be restarted for this update to take effect. After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-36160 httpd: mod_proxy_uwsgi: out-of-bounds read via a crafted request uri-path

notes.text: An out-of-bounds write in function ap_escape_quotes of httpd allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to crash the server or potentially execute code on the system with the privileges of the httpd user, by providing malicious input to the function.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2021-39275 httpd: Out-of-bounds write in ap_escape_quotes() via malicious input
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: No httpd module in Red Hat Enterprise Linux and Red Hat Software Collections pass untrusted data to ap_escape_quotes function, thus the Impact of the flaw has been set to Moderate.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-39275 httpd: Out-of-bounds write in ap_escape_quotes() via malicious input

notes.text: While fuzzing the 2.4.49 httpd, a new null pointer dereference was detected during HTTP/2 request processing, allowing an external source to DoS the server. This requires a specially crafted request. The vulnerability was recently introduced in version 2.4.49. No exploit is known to the project.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2021-41524 httpd: NULL pointer dereference via crafted request during HTTP/2 request processing
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue only affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.49 and Red Hat JBoss Core Services Apache HTTP Server 2.4.37 SP9, earlier versions are not affected. Therefore this issue does not affect the other versions of Apache HTTP Server shipped with Red Hat products.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Applications using the APR libraries, such as httpd, must be restarted for this update to take effect. After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-41524 httpd: NULL pointer dereference via crafted request during HTTP/2 request processing

notes.text: There's a null pointer dereference and server-side request forgery flaw in httpd's mod_proxy module, when it is configured to be used as a forward proxy. A crafted packet could be sent on the adjacent network to the forward proxy that could cause a crash, or potentially SSRF via misdirected Unix Domain Socket requests. In the worst case, this could cause a denial of service or compromise to confidentiality of data.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: possible NULL dereference or SSRF in forward proxy configurations
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw does not affect httpd configurations that do not use forward proxy functionality (configurations where ProxyRequests is turned off).
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
